```{r table-species-gain-global, results = 'asis'}
loadd(significant_gain_global, significant_gain_site, sites)
glance_table(significant_gain_global) %>%
  select(recipient, estimate, statistic, p.value) %>%
  mutate(recipient = paste0('{\\emph{ ', recipient, '}}')) %>%
  rename(`p value` = p.value,
         `difference` = estimate,
         `plant species` = recipient) %>%
  xtable(caption = "\\label{tab:table-species-gain-global} Results of testing the alternative hypothesis that the conspecific pollen density in open flowers is greater than the density in bagged flowers. Tests were performed at the species level (across communities).") %>%
  print.xtable(sanitize.text.function = function(x) x)
```

```{r table-species-gain-site, results = 'asis'}
loadd(significant_gain_global, significant_gain_site, sites)
glance_table(significant_gain_site) %>%
  inner_join(sites, by = "site_name") %>%
  group_by(recipient) %>%
  mutate(n_sites = n_distinct(site_name)) %>%
  filter(n_sites > 1) %>%
  group_by() %>%
  mutate(site_name = paste(locality_name, land_use, fragment, sep = ' - '),
         recipient = paste0('{\\emph{ ', recipient, '}}')) %>%
  select(recipient, site_name, estimate, statistic, p.value) %>%
  rename(`p value` = p.value,
         `difference` = estimate,
         `plant species` = recipient, 
         `community` = site_name) %>%
  xtable(caption = "Results of testing the alternative hypothesis that the conspecific pollen density in open flowers is greater than the density in bagged flowers. Tests were performed at the community level. Only species present in more than one community are shown.", 
         label= "tab:table-species-gain-site") %>%
  print(sanitize.text.function = function(x) x)
```

```{r table-variation-across-sites, results='asis'}

```

```{r fig-conspecific-per-site, fig.height = 7, fig.cap="Conspecific pollen density across plant species for different communities. Community names are abbreviated: AN stands for Anquilóo, LC for Las Chiclas, and SC for San Claudio."}
loadd(dep_frame, sites)
site_plots_conspecific <- dep_frame %>%
  filter(pollen_category == 'conspecific') %>%
  inner_join(sites, by = 'site_name') %>%
  mutate(recipient_short = shorten_sp_name(recipient)) %>% 
  plyr::dlply('site_name', function(x){
    x %>%
      ggplot(aes(y = pollen_density + 1, x = recipient_short,
                 fill = treatment)) +
      geom_boxplot(size = 0.25, outlier.size = 0.5, outlier.stroke = 0.5) +
      scale_y_log10(breaks = c(10,100,1000)) +
      coord_flip() + 
      ggtitle(paste(x$locality[1], '-', x$land_use, x$fragment)) +
      pub_theme() +
      xlab(NULL) +
      ylab('pollen density') +
      scale_fill_brewer(palette = "Greys")
  })

legend <- cowplot::get_legend(site_plots_conspecific[[1]])
 
site_plots_conspecific <- site_plots_conspecific %>%
  plyr::llply(function(x) {
    x + theme(legend.position = 'none', 
              title = element_text(size = 6))
  })

site_plots_conspecific <- rlist::list.append(site_plots_conspecific, legend)

cowplot::plot_grid(plotlist = site_plots_conspecific, ncol = 3)

```

```{r fig-conspecific-per-plant, fig.height = 7, fig.cap="Conspecific pollen density across communities for different study species. Only species present in more than onse site are shown. Community names are abbreviated: AN stands for Anquilóo, LC for Las Chiclas, and SC for San Claudio; A, and R indicate that the community corresponded to an agricultural or reserve site respectively."}
loadd(dep_frame, sites)
plant_plots_conspecific <- dep_frame %>%
  filter(pollen_category == 'conspecific') %>%
  inner_join(sites, by = 'site_name') %>%
  mutate(recipient_short = shorten_sp_name(recipient)) %>%
  group_by(recipient) %>%
  mutate(n_sites = n_distinct(site_name), 
         site_name = `str_sub<-`(site_name, 1, 3, value = ''), 
         site_name = str_replace_all(site_name, '_', ' - ')) %>%
  group_by() %>%
  filter(n_sites >= 2) %>%
  plyr::dlply('recipient', function(x){
    x %>%
      ggplot(aes(y = pollen_density + 1, x = site_name,
                 fill = treatment)) +
      geom_boxplot(size = 0.25, outlier.size = 0.5, outlier.stroke = 0.5) +
      scale_y_log10(breaks = c(10,100,1000)) +
      coord_flip() +
      ggtitle(paste(x$recipient[1])) +
      pub_theme() +
      xlab(NULL) +
      ylab('pollen density') +
      scale_fill_brewer(palette = "Greys")
  })

legend <- cowplot::get_legend(plant_plots_conspecific[[1]])

plant_plots_conspecific <- plant_plots_conspecific %>%
  plyr::llply(function(x) {
    x + theme(legend.position = 'none',
              title = element_text(size = 6))
  })

plant_plots_conspecific <- rlist::list.append(plant_plots_conspecific, legend)

cowplot::plot_grid(plotlist = plant_plots_conspecific, ncol = 3)
```

```{r fig-abundance-logtransformed-or-not, fig.height = 3, fig.cap = "Distribution of plant abundance as (A) raw counts of floral units across communities, and (B) after applying a data transformation in which the counts have been "}
loadd(plant_rel_abu, sites)

p1 <- plant_rel_abu %>%
  inner_join(sites, by = 'site_name') %>%
  ggplot() +
  stat_density(aes(x = abu_com_rel_log, colour = locality_name),
               position = position_identity(), geom = 'line') +
  # stat_density(aes(x = abu_tot_rel_log), geom = 'line') +
  scale_color_brewer(palette = "Set1") +
  pub_theme() +
  # guides(colour = guide_legend(title = 'locality'), linetype = guide_legend(title = 'land use')) +
  labs(colour = 'locality', x = 'relative abundance')

p2 <- plant_rel_abu %>%
  inner_join(sites, by = 'site_name') %>%
  ggplot(aes(x = abu_tot)) +
  stat_density(position = position_identity(), geom = 'line') +
  scale_color_brewer(palette = "Set1") +
  pub_theme() +
  labs(x = 'abundance (floral units)')

cowplot::plot_grid(p2, p1, rel_widths = c(0.42, 0.58), labels = LETTERS[1:2], label_size = 8)

```
